document.docAuthor: Zhou, Xian, Dietrich, Christopher H., Zhang, Yalin & Huang, Min
document.masterDocTitle: Five new species of the leafhopper genus Limassolla Dlabola (Hemiptera Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Five new species of the leafhopper genus Limassolla Dlabola (Hemiptera Cicadellidae: Typhlocybinae)

heading.emphasis:
Key to species (males) of the subgenus
Limassolla ( Limassolla )
from China , Japan and Korea

subSubSection.paragraph:
(Modified from Song & Li 2011 . Note:
L. bielawskii Dworakowska, 1969
and
L. dostali Dworakowska & Lauterer, 1975
are omitted because they are known only from females.)

paragraph.keyLead:
1. Aedeagus without processes (
Limassolla multipunctata
group)................................................. 2
2. Aedeagal shaft compressed, much wider in lateral view than in posterior view..................................... 3
- Aedeagal shaft tubular, approximately same width in lateral and posterior views................................... 5

3. Aedeagal shaft with dorsal margin strongly sclerotized, apex concave in posterior view..................................................................................................
L. lingchuanensis ( Chou & Zhang, 1985 )
- Aedeagal shaft uniformly sclerotized, apex rounded or tapered in posterior view................................... 4

4. Aedeagus with posterior margin evenly rounded in lateral view; subgenital plate with two long macrosetae subbasally...............................................................................
L. emmrichi Dworakowska, 1972

- Aedeagus with posterior margin subquadrate in lateral view; subgenital plate with single long macroseta subbasally...............................................................................
L. multipunctata (Matsumura, 1920)

5. Aedeagal shaft apex rounded or obliquely truncate in lateral and posterior views..........
L. ishiharai Dworakowska, 1972
- Aedeagal shaft tapered to sharp point or irregular in lateral or posterior views..................................... 6

6. Aedeagal shaft apex tapered to sharp point in lateral and posterior views............
L. rubrolimbata Zhang & Chou, 1988
- Aedeagal shaft apex irregularly rounded in lateral and posterior views........................................... 7

7. Aedeagal shaft with longitudinal lateral ridge; connective without median anterior lobe................
L. kunyica
sp. nov.

- Aedeagus shaft without lateral ridge; connective with median anterior lobe..........................
L. uncata
sp. nov.

8. Aedeagus with apical and basal processes, either single or paired (
Limassolla dworakowskae
group).................... 9
- Aedeagus with either apical or basal processes, but not both.................................................. 12

10. Aedeagus apical processes lamella-like, with serrated lateral margins.....................
L. yingjianga Song & Li, 2011

- Aedeagus apical processes teeth-like................................................
L. unica Zhang & Xiao, 2000

11. Aedeagus with paired basal processes.........................................
L. dworakowskae Chou & Ma, 1981

- Aedeagus with single basal process...............................................
L. qianfoensis Song & Li, 2011

12. Aedeagus with 1–4 apical processes, no basal process (
Limassolla dispunctata
group).............................. 13

- Aedeagus with basal process or processes, no apical process (
Limassolla aureata
group)............................ 22
14. Apical processes of aedeagal shaft petiolate at base......................................................... 15

- Apical processes of aedeagal shaft directly bifurcate...................................
L. diospyri Chou & Ma, 1981
15. Two pairs of apical processes of aedeagal shaft bifurcate...................................................... 16

- One pair of apical processes of aedeagal shaft bifurcate..............................
L. dispunctata Chou & Ma, 1981

16. Aedeagus apical processes length similar to preapical processes..........................
L . hebeiensis
Cai et al ., 1992

- Aedeagus apical processes shorter than preapical processes..........................
L . dangjinensis Sumin et al ., 2020

17. Aedeagus with pair of apical processes extended distad and unpaired preapical processes extended basad.........................................................................................
L. discoloris Zhang & Chou, 1988

18. Apex of aedeagus with three processes, one extended distally and two extended basad.......
L. koreana
Hossain et al ., 2019
- Aedeagus with one pair of processes, without unpaired process............................................... 19

20. Forewing mostly dark with large pale spots; aedeagus abruptly narrowed preapically in lateral view....................................................................................................
L. kakii Chou & Ma, 1981

- Forewing mostly pale with small dark spots; aedeagus evenly tapered preapically in lateral view......
L. bicruralis
sp. nov.

21. Each aedeagal process wide and flat, with distinct preapical angle............................
L. rutila Song & Li, 2011

- Each aedeagal process narrow and long, without preapical angle.....................
L. yunnanana Zhang & Chou, 1988

23. Aedeagus with basal processes broad, longer than shaft.............................
L. galewskii Dworakowska, 1969
- Aedeagus with basal processes slender, shorter than aedeagal shaft............................................. 24
- Aedeagus with basal process as long as or longer than shaft................................................... 28

26. Basal process of aedeagus denticulate......................................................
L. spinulata
sp. nov.

27. Aedeagus with basal process well separated from shaft in lateral view.....................
L. auriculata Song & Li, 2011

- Aedeagus with basal process closely appressed to shaft in lateral view........................
L. nigropunctata
sp. nov.

28. Connective with median anterior lobe, aedeagus with shaft emarginate apically in lateral view...................................................................................................
L. discreta Chou & Zhang, 1985

29. Aedeagus basal process longer than aedeagal shaft, apex bifurcate in posterior view.....
L. multimacula
Chiang et al ., 1988

- Aedeagus basal process as long as aedeagal shaft, apex tapered in posterior view.............
L. lanyua
Chiang et al ., 1989
